webResources.textAttributionSnippet: (en) "3 women and 2 men gathered in rooms with a tiled stove. 1 dog seated inside one woman. A. J. Malmgren sitting second from right. The interior is from bookkeeper B. E. Otterström’s floor, North Hamnär 4. The walls adorned with various boards, ornamental objects. 2 pcs bust and oil lamp. A lime oven in the corner. Dog in the foreground. : See photon. 6971: 9-10, the accompanying machine-written text exists, which reads: "With warm thanks for the postcards of the Malmska elections, we are allowed to send some fotos of natural history department’s old conservator A. J. Malmgren as a modest counterpart. One by photographer A. Andre, Stenungsund (6971: 9), the other interior - taken by unnamed photographer in the 1890s (6971: 10). Malmgren Second from Right. The interior is from bookkeeper B. E. Otterström’s floor, North Hamnström4. Mrs Emma Otterström was the sister of Malmgren. The original photographs are owned by Mrs Birgit Svensson, Vegagatan 56, Gothenburg. We have thus now acquired negative results through the shooting of the original. With heartfelt greeting Arvid Flygare “” - https://www.europeana.eu/item/52/gnm_photo_GNM6971_010. Göteborgs naturhistoriska museum - http://digitaltmuseum.se/021015953610. CC BY - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/
